      • init

        public long init(long capacity,
                 String uri,
                 boolean isnew)
        Description copied from interface: VolatileMemoryAllocatorService
        Initialize a memory pool through native interface backed by native library.
        Specified by:
        init in interface VolatileMemoryAllocatorService
        Parameters:
        capacity - the capacity of memory pool
        uri - the location of memory pool will be created
        isnew - a place holder, always specify it as true
        Returns:
        the identifier of created memory pool

      • allocate

        public long allocate(long id,
                     long size,
                     boolean initzero)
        Description copied from interface: VolatileMemoryAllocatorService
        allocate specified size of memory block from backed memory pool.
        Specified by:
        allocate in interface VolatileMemoryAllocatorService
        Parameters:
        id - the identifier of backed memory pool
        size - specify size of memory block to be allocated
        Returns:
        the address of allocated memory block from native memory pool

      • reallocate

        public long reallocate(long id,
                       long address,
                       long size,
                       boolean initzero)
        Description copied from interface: VolatileMemoryAllocatorService
        reallocate a specified size of memory block from backed memory pool.
        Specified by:
        reallocate in interface VolatileMemoryAllocatorService
        Parameters:
        id - the identifier of backed memory pool
        address - the address of previous allocated memory block. it can be null.
        size - specify new size of memory block to be reallocated
        Returns:
        the address of reallocated memory block from native memory pool

      • free

        public void free(long id,
                 long address)
        Description copied from interface: VolatileMemoryAllocatorService
        free a memory block by specify its address into backed memory pool.
        Specified by:
        free in interface VolatileMemoryAllocatorService
        Parameters:
        id - the identifier of backed memory pool
        address - the address of allocated memory block.

      • createByteBuffer

        public ByteBuffer createByteBuffer(long id,
                                   long size)
        Description copied from interface: VolatileMemoryAllocatorService
        create a ByteBuffer object which backed buffer is coming from backed native memory pool.
        Specified by:
        createByteBuffer in interface VolatileMemoryAllocatorService
        Parameters:
        id - the identifier of backed memory pool
        size - the size of backed buffer that is managed by created ByteBuffer object.
        Returns:
        a created ByteBuffer object with a backed native memory block

      • resizeByteBuffer

        public ByteBuffer resizeByteBuffer(long id,
                                   ByteBuffer bytebuf,
                                   long size)
        Description copied from interface: VolatileMemoryAllocatorService
        resize a ByteBuffer object which backed buffer is coming from backed native memory pool. NOTE: the ByteBuffer object will be renewed and lost metadata e.g. position, mark and etc.
        Specified by:
        resizeByteBuffer in interface VolatileMemoryAllocatorService
        Parameters:
        id - the identifier of backed memory pool
        bytebuf - the specified ByteBuffer object to be destroyed
        size - the new size of backed buffer that is managed by created ByteBuffer object.
        Returns:
        a created ByteBuffer object with a backed native memory block

      • destroyByteBuffer

        public void destroyByteBuffer(long id,
                              ByteBuffer bytebuf)
        Description copied from interface: VolatileMemoryAllocatorService
        destroy a native memory block backed ByteBuffer object.
        Specified by:
        destroyByteBuffer in interface VolatileMemoryAllocatorService
        Parameters:
        id - the identifier of backed memory pool
        bytebuf - the specified ByteBuffer object to be destroyed
